items.summary: Make the first screen shown on initial app load a dedicated mobile-number entry page with an input and two actions: “Continue” (save number) and “Skip” (do not save). Do not show the main app content or the menu button until the user chooses Continue or Skip.

When the user enters a mobile number on the first screen, persist it so it can be used as the user’s username by saving it into the caller’s profile phone number field (DatingProfile.phoneNumber). If the user is not yet authenticated or does not yet have a profile at the time of entry, store the number locally and apply it automatically to the profile as soon as saving the caller profile becomes possible.

After completing the mobile-number entry (Continue or Skip), show the exact same “next page” content that the app currently shows (no removal of existing features/content), including the existing menu button and navigation.

Remove/fix the persistent web-page overlay so that no unintended transparent/blur overlay blocks interaction after the menu is closed. Specifically, ensure that any overlay used for the menu only exists while the menu is open and is fully removed/disabled when closed.

Apply an orange-and-pink background theme across the entire app (all pages, including the first mobile-number screen and the existing main pages). The background should clearly show orange and pink (e.g., a gradient) and remain consistent across navigation.
